fields.description:
When a project has the project permission "Browse Projects" with "Any logged user" in it, this actually causes any user registered in the application to appear (not users that are able to log in) and this in turn could cause users with no application access (and therefore not being able to log in) to receive mails from mentions, that include information about issues that they cannot actually see. 

This behavior is confusing, and the proposed solution is to rename the "Any user logged in" application access category to just "Any user".
fields.summary: The way the Permission "Application access - Any user logged in" works with mentions is misleading

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Lucene index backups are created without an integrity check. This can lead to scenarios where the backup is corrupt or otherwise unusable in a scenario where the backup is needed.
h3. Suggestion

Perform an integrity check when creating an index backup
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Perform an integrity check when creating an index backup

fields.description:

 2. Expand sidebar, epics and issue details
 3. Zoom in to 125% or make window smaller

 
||Actual(8.0)||Expected(7.13)||
|Story points are hidden

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * Perform quick search using project key
 * See results are only including issues from the searched project
 * Click column to sort
 * Notice that search parameters are removed, empty JQL searching all issues.

Expected Behavior:
 * Expected that search parameters remain in place after sort. This is the behavior in all versions prior to 8.0
 ** Currently jira.atlassian.com shows the expected behavior. (v7.13.0-m0003)
 ** v8.0.0-RELEASE dogfood instance shows problem behavior
fields.summary: Column sort after quick search results in empty JQL search
Bulk delete user saved filters

fields.description:
It is very common in true Kanban use to utilize "Done" sub-columns under various activity columns.  The Jira Software does not allow that.

It should not be that hard to allow creation and usage of a "Done" sub-column, for example, under "In Progress".  Currently, this requires adding a brand new column, so if there are 3 columns between "To Do" and the final "Done", each of those columns requires a duplicate "Done" columns, so we go from 5 to 8 columns.

A sub-column would simply divide the total column width.  Yes, it would of necessity shrink the cards, but info displayed on the cards could be adjusted accordingly.

It appears there was a decision made at some point to not do this, but I've never seen it explained or defended.

Please consider this.  Also, we are using Jira Server, and have no current plans to go to Jira Cloud.
fields.summary: Add sub-columns option to Jira Server Board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when users are commenting on Jira issues and use tab to publish the comment, the "Undo"
 button will be selected instead, which is not intuitive.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to use tab once after commenting to publish the text.

h3. Why this is important

It will provide a user experience for our customers.
fields.summary: Allow users to use tab once to publish text after commenting

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On moving Issue to another project, JIRA doesn't check the permission for Create Issue for Reporter. JIRA should not fill that Reporter field during moving an issue, if the former reporter doesn't have *Create Issue* permission in project B.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in projectA with UserA
 # Create projectB.
 # Update the permission scheme for projectB to restrict user from *Create Issue* permission.
 # Move Issue from projectA to projectB

h3. Expected Results

Reporter field should be 'Anonymous' as the original reporter doesn't the correct have permission in projectB. 

h3. Actual Results

The original reporter is still the reporter for the issue in projectB although he doesn't have *Create Issue* permission in projectB
fields.summary: Jira is not checking the Create Issue permission for Reporter when moving an issue between projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

[Audit log|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/auditing-in-jira-applications-938847740.html] feature was much improved thanks to JRASERVER-3157 but there is still something we can improve.

It was already mentioned in [the original request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-3157] as follows but there seems to be no public facing ticket for that so I raised this request.

bq. We'll continue to work on the audit log events, tracking any further requests in this suggestion, which already includes changes to custom field contexts, resolutions, and global system settings.

Currently, there is nothing shown in the audit log when some options are added or the application contexts are updated in existing custom fields and it is troublesome for Jira admin.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be better to show audit logs even in the above cases.
fields.summary: Improve audit log for custom field updated event

fields.description:
The comments section of Jira easily gets convoluted with multiple conversations happening simultaneously. 

As a Jira user, I would like to be able to leave a reply to a specific comment on a ticket and not have my comment appear at the bottom of the thread so that my comment can be directly associated with the comment to which I am responding rather than just getting added to the bottom of the list. 

Note: this functionality exists in Confluence (shown below)

!image-2018-11-09-10-03-43-477.png!
fields.summary: Commenting - Add ability to make sub-comments

fields.description:
Please bring login page when session expires automatically instead of "not authorized" messages while menu status still indicates that person is logged in (so we have only option to log out on the menu). The current behavior has been confusing for years. The udea is that if session expired then on any action login screen should be brought with any additional steps with message errors that are unproductive and confusing at times. Thi is how many apps behave these days, but I see that Jira is still behind with improving this part. 

 

Bringing error messages like that might have sounded like a good idea 5-7 years ago, but after getting used to redundant clicks and learning the same message works against UI productivity. Let's eliminate unnecessary clicks  and steps in user interaction with system. It is pretty obvious what user needs to do continue working with application if session expired so bring that login screen automatically, please.
fields.summary: JIRA Login Behavior Improvement

fields.description: Mark Logs option currently marks only the logs of local instance. It should mark logs of all nodes in Jira Data Center environment. (Marking only local or all logs can be made optional)
fields.summary: Mark Logs options should mark logs of all nodes in Jira Data Center environment

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*


In this document https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/working-with-search-results-939938808.html, it is not mentioned that deactivating an owner of an issue subscription stops mails from being sent to other users who are subscribers to the filter.

Developers have confirmed that there is simple check in Jira code which checks if owner of subscription is active and it doesn't send emails if it's not:
*com.atlassian.jira.issue.subscription.DefaultSubscriptionManager#runSubscription(final FilterSubscription sub)*
{code} if (userManager.getUserByKey(sub.getUserKey()).isActive()) {code}

*Suggested resolution*

Modify the linked documentation so it mentions that emails to filter subscribers won't get sent once the owner of the filter subscription gets inactive in Jira.
fields.summary: Modify "Subscribing to your search results" section in "Working with search results" document

fields.description: The Database Statistics section under System Info shows the count of many different entities like issues, comments and many various schemes. It should also show the number of total change groups and change items as these are also important in sizing an instance
fields.summary: Database Statistics under System Info should show history size

fields.description:
Menu entry "Releases" does not match the field namings "Fix Versions" or "Affected Versions".

This sometimes leads to confusions for end users as they do not know that the releases or those versions.
fields.summary: Change "Release" name to be in hand by hand with "Fix Versions" and "Affected Versions""

fields.description:
When you add a group as a editor of a filter then tries do add the same group as a viewer of the filter, Jira does not display an warning message. Instead it just shows a red line around the Editor.
 # Create a filter
 # Edit Permissions
 # Add a group or user to be a +viewer+ of the filter
 # Add the same group to be an +editor+ of the Filter
 # Jira gives a dialog box saying "_Chosen share target is already a viewer. Remove and add as editor?_" (Expected behaviour so far)

Do it backwards:
 # Create a filter
 # Edit Permissions
 # Add a group to be an +editor+ of the filter
 # Add the same group or user to be an +viewer+ of the filter

*Observed behaviour:*
 Clicking Add just makes a red line on the screen around the editor.

*Expected behaviour:*
 Jira to display an warning message: "_Chosen share target is already an editor. There is no need to add as a Viewer_"
fields.summary: Display a warning message when same group that is editor is added as viewer of the filter

fields.description: There is currently no way to disable notifications being sent for 'mentions' events, however we have several high-security projects where we need to significantly limit the emails being sent out to prevent sensitive data leakage.  Please add an option to enable/disable mentions emails to Notification Schemes.
fields.summary: Allow disabling mentions notifications via Notification Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Due to the Attachment field is not added in the Create Issue screen, it should not be possible to attach a file. In case it is an Image, Copy + Pasting an image to the Description in Visual Mode will have the image rendered with a warning. After it is created, the image will be broken.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Navigate to _Project > Project Settings > Screens_
# Edit the Create Issue Screen.
# Remove the Attachment field.
# Create a new issue on the same project.
# Take a screenshot to Clipboard and paste it to the Description while in Visual Tab.

h3. Expected Result:
A message where adding an attachment is not possible will appear and the image won't be attached.

h3. Actual Result:
A message did appear and the image still rendered. Proceeding on creating the ticket will have the image broken.
fields.summary: Image still rendered even though it is not possible to attach

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing formats in Visual Mode, it can cause the text anchors to disappear.

*Scenario:*
Step 1: Set a Description like this
 !scr1.png|thumbnail! 

Step 2: Edit the Description, it will look like this in Text Mode
 !scr2.png|thumbnail! 

Step 3: Switch to Visual Mode, highlight 'content 1' and apply Heading 1
 !scr3.png|thumbnail! 

Step 4: By switching back to Text Mode, the anchors are gone (even those that are not edited yet)
 !scr4.png|thumbnail! 

Step 5: This will cause the format to be lost once saved
 !scr5.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Changes are made and the original format are intact

h3. Actual Results
Original format are lost

h3.Workaround
Make the format changes only in Text Mode. Visual Mode can be used just as a preview before saving the changes.
fields.summary: Text anchors are lost when applying format in Visual Mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The administrator wants to customize login gadget at Dashboard.jspa (i.e. change the error message when an authentication failure occurs). This is done as usual by adding the new string to the suitable key at language jar file as below. However, the change is not visible to end-users until they flush browser caches. This is a problem for larger deployments with thousands of users, where you can't all users to flush their caches.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # install a new Jira Server
 # add the following line as the last line to
 *{{com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport_en_US.properties}}* file at *{{WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/jira-languages-7.6.7-en_US.jar}}*
{noformat}
gadget.login.invalidlogin=This is the new customized message
{noformat}

 # restart the server
 # try to login with a wrong password

h3. Expected Results

"This is the new customized message" shall be displayed as the error message
h3. Actual Results

Old message is displayed, instead of "This is the new customized message". This happens until you flush the cache, and then the new message is displayed.
h3. Workaround

Changing widget color scheme causes the browser to fetch new resources without flushing the cache
 # go to *Administration* > *System* > *User Interface *> *Look and feel*
 # scroll down *Colors* > *Gadget Colors*. Click on the line containing *Color1*
 # change the color, and click *Update*
 # logout, and test to log in with a wrong password to see the customized error message

note: reverting back to old color causes also the message to revert back to the old value
fields.summary: Login Gadget customizations for messages does not reflect until browser cache is flushed

fields.description:
Customers would like to receive WebHooks when a user or group is added to a project role.

For user, it's good to know:

For group, it's good to get the list of group members as well.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The error message reported in the Jira logs about the connection pool acquired by a thread is not reporting right numbers : 
{code}2018-11-06 08:17:23,168 ajp-nio-8009-exec-54 WARN xxxxx 497x1787252x1 yyyyyy 10.188.174.111 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [c.a.jira.ofbiz.ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor] Dangerous use of multiple connections: replaced => count=0; marks=[-1-0]; pool=151/80
2018-11-06 08:17:23,108 ajp-nio-8009-exec-54 WARN xxxxx 497x1787252x1 yyyyyy 10.188.174.111 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [c.a.jira.ofbiz.ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor] Dangerous use of multiple connections: replaced => count=1; marks=[0-0]; pool=153/80
2018-11-06 08:17:23,107 ajp-nio-8009-exec-54 WARN xxxxx 497x1787252x1 yyyyyy 10.188.174.111 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [c.a.jira.ofbiz.ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor] Dangerous use of multiple connections: taken => count=2; marks=[1-0]; pool=154/80{code}

It also can be shown like this:
{code}2020-12-14 11:14:54,477 Caesium-1-4 WARN anonymous [c.a.jira.ofbiz.ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor] Dangerous use of multiple connections: replaced => count=0; marks=[-1-3]; pool=1/100
2020-12-14 11:14:55,479 Caesium-1-4 WARN anonymous
[c.a.jira.ofbiz.ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor] Dangerous use of multiple connections: taken => count=3; marks=[2-3]; pool=3/100{code}

h3. Expected Results
The error above would report the used and available connection pools accurately.

h3. Actual Results
The error message reports the wrong number as 154/80 or 1/100 are not comprehensible :(

h3. Workaround
Jira administrators should focus on the  _Database Monitoring_ page within Jira Administration console as that should be more accurate than the logs.
fields.summary: "Dangerous use of multiple connections" - error reports wrong number of connections

fields.description: When group or users to roles, etc., searching should be case-insensitive for both.  If you have a User named "Gordon, Jeff", entering "jeff" will find it.  If you have a Group named "Jeff Group", entering "jeff" will not find it.

fields.description:
When editing the Administrators for an Agile Board, when you start typing, the matching Groups are listed first and then matching Users.

When editing the Role for a Project, when you start typing, the matching Users are listed first and then matching Groups.

These should behave the same.  Our suggestion is to always list Groups first.
fields.summary: Be consistent when presenting groups/users for selection in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If two or more issues have the same creation time *to the second*, only the last updated one will show in the activity stream. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two issues in Jira
# Change the creation time of one issue in the DB to be the same as the other one to the second
# Make a change to issue 1
# Make sure the issue is visible in the activity stream in the user's profile http://<BASE_URL>/secure/ViewProfile.jspa
# Make a change to issue 2
# Refresh the user profile page

h3. Expected Results
Issue 1 and issue 2 should be visible in the activity stream.

h3. Actual Results
Only issue 2 (the last updated issue) is visible. 
 
h3. Notes
Both issues will show in the activity stream if they're both reported by the user who's refreshing their profile. 

h3.Workaround
Update the issue creation time of one of the issues in the DB to be at a different second.
fields.summary: User profile activity stream does not show all issues with the same creation date

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

In the documentation [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-csv-938847533.html], it does not include any documentation about importing issue links. This includes the information about :
 * How you can only create outbound links if you import new issues from a CSV and create a link for them to an existing issue.
 * Inbound and Outbound links can only be created if you are linking new issues that are being created when CSV is imported.

Also, additional information from this [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-import-issue-links-from-a-csv-file-740262715.html] can be included in the documentation.
fields.summary: Include Importing Issue Links in the Importing data from CSV

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Difference in number of issues in index and the database increase over time, until a *lock & re-index* operation is done to get all indexes in sync again.

h3. Environment
Jira Data Center

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Still unknown

h3. Expected Results
Difference between number of issues in the database and in the nodes local indexes is eventually zero.

h3. Actual Results
Difference in the number of issues in the database and in the nodes local indexes start to drift after a *lock & re-index* operation, and indexes will not catch up as expected.

The charts below were generated using the results of the REST API endpoint {{/rest/api/2/index/summary}}. Note how the delta between issues in the database and issues in the local index starts to drift. Indexes will remain inconsistent in relation to the database until a *lock & re-index* operation is performed.
 !image.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note on fix
* The following contributors to this issue that we've identified:
** JRASERVER-64922 
** JRASERVER-65564
***  have been fixed and are awaiting release (fix versions: 7.6.11, 7.13.1, 8.0.0).
** JRASERVER-68642 - pending
* As of 2019-01-02, we were unable to identify any other contributors to this issue.

h3.Workaround
There's no workaround to prevent the issue from happening. It's necessary to perform a *lock & re-index* operation to make the indexes consistent again.
fields.summary: Jira Data Center local indexes get inconsistent over time

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce :

1- Create a new user directory with one user.

2- Create a project  with a few issues assign some of them to existing users and  others  unassigned
3- Assign an issue to the  user part of the new user directory.
4- Run Pie chart on the project and choose "Assignee" for the filed "Statistics Type"
5- The user will be displayed with the counter set to 1
6- Disable the new Directory 
7- The Pie chart will not display that user and the counter of the "unassigned will be increased by 1

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Deleting a Jira project removes all related attachments (as designed). However, it leaves the root empty directory.

_jira-home/data/attachments_ before and after project deletion
||before||after||
|{noformat}
TEST
└── TEST-1
    └── 10300

1 directory, 1 file
{noformat}|{noformat}
TEST



0 directory, 0 file
{noformat}|

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project
# Add a new issue and add an attachment
# Delete the project
# Notice that the root folder is left behind

h3. Expected Results
For redundancy purposes, the root folder should be removed even though the folder is empty. This allows better management of data by admins.

h3. Actual Results
The empty root folder is left behind.

h3.Workaround
Delete the folder manually.
fields.summary: Deleting a Jira project removes all corresponding attachments, but leaves the root (empty) directory

fields.description:
*Scenario 1:*
Let's say that user extends Jira Service Desk license and decides to upgrade Jira Service Desk to newer version. During upgrade of Jira applications (e.g. Service Desk), Jira Core also gets upgraded.
* If this instance includes Jira Software as well, and if this application uses expired license, Jira won't warn the user that Jira Software won't be able to run due to expried license
* After the Service Desk (+Core) upgrade has been finished, when Jira Software get upgraded, user cannot activate Jira Software and gets "License Too Old For Build: We found a problem with your JIRA license" error

We suggest implementing mechanism that would clearly mention to user that specific license wouldn't be usable with the upgraded application (and therefore, the application won't be usable as well).

*Scenario 2:*
This can actually lead to JIRA database and folders being upgraded regardless that the license actually is not eligible for the upgrade, which will result in a broken JIRA installation. I.e. JIRA is upgraded, but, the upgraded JIRA won't be able to start due to expired license and then reverting both the database and JIRA folders back to the pre-upgrade state will be required. 
For this scenario, it would be great if a license check is done during the JIRA startup, and if the license is invalid for the upgrade, JIRA shouldn't proceed with the upgrade advising the customer accordingly (License is invalid for the upgrade, please roll back to the previous version or something like that)
fields.summary: Jira doesn't warn user about expired license for other installed application during the upgrade procedure

h3. Actual Results

fields.summary: IE11 renders links incorrectly

fields.description:
When pasting formatted text from a text editor such as Notepad++ and/or Sublime text editors into the description using the Visual Editor the following may happen:

Anything starting with a Tab will be duplicated and line end/return will be ignored
 Pre paste:
{quote}     hello
 world.
 isn't this 
 a beautiful day?
{quote}
Post paste:
{quote}hello helloworld.isn't this a beautiful day?
{quote}
Anything starting with a special character will be duplicated and line end/return will be ignored
 Pre Paste:
{quote}<random>
    <more>
        <text>
{quote}
Post paste:
{quote}<random><random> <more> <text>
{quote}
Using the Text editor does not cause this issue, only the visual editor.

 
h2. *Work around:*

Right click near the cursor, paste your formatted text.

OR

Use the Text editor to paste formatted text will also semi-respect and maintain the format.
fields.summary: Pasting formatted text into Visual Description removes formatting

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When accidentally importing a CSV into the wrong project – and in a specific set of circumstances – a deleted issue key can be reused. This is an edge-case bug requiring a very specific set of circumstances to trigger, but raising since it's not expected for a previously-deleted key to be reused like this.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create two test projects (Project A, Project B) in Jira (I used Basic Software)
* Create five test issues in Project A
* Create five test issues in Project B
* In Project B, set no default issue type and move *Epic* to the first position on the list
* In Project B, delete one of the five test issues
* Export Current Fields CSV from Project A, edit and leave only the issue key and summary columns
* Add a new column - "Relates to"
* For each issue in the Issue Key field (e.g., PA-1) add the corresponding issue from Project B to the "Relates To" column (e.g., PB-1). See attached example.
* Import the CSV file into Project B (this is incorrect procedure, but is needed to expose the bug). Import the "Relates To" column as *Link "Relates"*
* If reproduction was a success, you should note the recreation in Project B of the previously-deleted issue key, now as an Epic issue type


h3. Expected Results
Issue created during import should have used the next key in sequence.

h3. Actual Results
Previously-deleted issue key is reused.
fields.summary: Deleted issue key may be reassigned during a CSV import

fields.description: The colors of the Pie Chart gadget are inconsistent in terms of matching color to a specific category of a "Statistic Type." For example, using "Status" as the "Statistic Type" can result in different statuses being mapped to different colors across multiple pie charts. It doesn't make much sense to upper management to display a pie chart for one project that shows the percentage of "In Progress" issues in red for one project then to have another pie chart show "In Progress" issues in blue for another project. This can quickly get very confusing when updating upper management on project statuses. Furthermore, the color scheme does not make sense at all for the issue statuses. Associating the color green with "To Do" and red with "Done" makes zero sense to most people. It should be the other way around. Please fix this as it makes it very difficult to use Jira as a Program Management tool when its charts can cause miscommunication to upper management this easily. My suggested fix would be to let the user pick which color is assigned to each category of the "Statistic Type" via a drop down on the Pie Chart's legend.
fields.summary: Pie Chart Gadget Colors Inconsistent

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*:

1) Create two projects A and B with following Security Levels.

Project A Security Levels:
 A1 (default)
 A2
 A3

Project B Security Levels:
 B1 (default)
 B2 
 B3

2) Create an issue "A-1" in project A and set the value of "Security Level" field to A1.
 3) Open issue A-1 in two separate browsers (e.g. Chrome and Firefox).
 4) In chrome, move issue A-1 from project A to project B using "Move" operation and select B1 value for "Security level" field during the move.
 5) In Firefox, try updating issue A-1 using inline edit and change the value of "Security Level" field from A1 to A3. Jira will show message "_Saving of A-1 failed!_" (Expected behaviour so far) 
 6) Try to open issue A-1

*Observed behaviour:*
 Error message:

_This issue can't be viewed_
 _The issue you're trying to view can't be displayed._
 _It may have been deleted or you don't have permission to view it right now._ 

*Expected behaviour:*
 Issue A-1 is accessible

*Investigation:*
 Regardless of the error message displayed in step 5, the {{changeitem}} table is updated with a new entry: {{OLDSTRING "B1"}} and {{NEWSTRING "A3"}}
 This results in the issue to be inconsistent and not accessible in neither of the projects.
fields.summary: Issue is inaccessible after project move and security level change

A follow-up to JRASERVER-64095,
bq.  However as this technology is used outside of server Jira too it contains timeout feature. Timeout is calculated from the beginning of the request, so when the whole request is too long, the pipe will give up on rendering. *Fix removes this timeout for Jira.*

Remove the dark feature {{com.atlassian.jira.config.BIG_PIPE_KILLSWITCH}} so BigPipe will be enabled for sidebar always.

fields.description:
Hi,

As a JIRA Admin I would like to prevent search engines from indexing my (private) JIRA instance.

*Current situation*

Filesystem modifications are needed to modify the robots.txt (as per [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/using-robots-txt-to-hide-from-search-engines-861253859.html] )

 

*Problem*

The modifications need to be repeated for every update/upgrade, which makes updating hard, more time consuming and causes friction

 

*Suggestion*

Option A: Make the robots.txt editable from within Jira without the need to modify the filesystem

Option B: Provide a switch for Jira Admins to "Prevent indexing of this Jira instance by search engines", which could set meta headers like noindex, nofollow as an alternative to robots.txt. But this is aleady covered in JRASERVER-64852
fields.summary: Make robots.txt manageable from within JIRA

fields.description:
*Summary*

When editing a user's username and only the _case_ is changed, the user's row in {{cwd_user}} is _updated_ but the change is silently not performed.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Go to the *User management* page (/secure/admin/user/UserBrowser.jspa)
# Click *Edit*. The *Edit user profile* pop-up appears. 
# Change the case of the *Username* (i.e. change *"peter"* to *"PeTeR"*) and click *Update*.
# This shoots off an HTTP POST to {{/secure/admin/user/EditUser.jsp}} which contains the updated username _with_ the changed case.
{noformat}
          "method": "POST",
          "url": "http://localhost:8086/secure/admin/user/EditUser.jspa",
[...]
             {
                "name": "username",
                "value": "PeTeR"
              },
[...]
              {
                "name": "editName",
                "value": "peter"
              },
{noformat}
# *cwd_user.user_name* remains unchanged. No error in the log.

*Expected Results*
*cwd_user.user_name* should be changed to reflect the change in case (i.e. changing *"peter"* to *"PeTeR"*)

*Actual Results*
*cwd_user.udpated_date* changes, but *cwd_user.username* does not change (i.e. changing *"peter"* to *"PeTeR"* in the UI results in *cwd_user.user_name='peter'* still).

*Workaround*
No known workaround
fields.summary: Can't edit username case through the UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Jira's [REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/latest/], there are certain endpoints which accept and require a user's *UserKey* (represented in the database as app_user.user_key) as an input parameter or argument.

However, the documentation suggests that the parameter should be the user's *UserName*, which is not necessarily the same value as the user's *UserKey*. In general, a user's *UserKey* is the first username that they were ever created with; if in the future, the user were to have their username changed for any reason, their *UserKey* will still be the original, first value.

This can confuse Admins and Users who try to use these REST API endpoints by providing a *UserName* (likely the value which they use to log in with, for example), and find that the endpoints do not function correctly.

Furthermore, the *UserKey* is not visible in Jira's UI. Admins can only find the *UserKey* by:
* Querying against the database against the *app_user* database table
* Using the *Get User* REST API endpoint, which does accept *UserName*, and returns the *UserKey* as a value (key)
** $JIRA_URL/rest/api/2/user?username=<User_Name>

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Jira user (i.e. UserName = test)
# Immediately change their username (i.e. UserName = newtest)
# Add them to a Project Role in any project
# Attempt to use the *+Delete Actor+* method for the api/2/project/{projectIdOrKey}/role endpoint to remove them from the Project Role

h3. Expected Results

An HTTP 204 is returned per the REST API documentation, and the user is no longer in the Project Role for the project in question.

h3. Actual Results
An HTTP 204 is returned, but the user is still there in the Project Role for the project in question. No information is provided to the admin clearly demonstrating what has gone wrong.
 
h3. Workaround
The behavior of the REST API endpoints which demonstrate this behavior cannot be changed. Instead, Admins and Users must first identify the *UserKey* through either of the methods described above before using these endpoints.
* Querying against the database against the *app_user* database table
* Using the *Get User* REST API endpoint, which does accept *UserName*, and returns the *User Key* as a value
** $JIRA_URL/rest/api/2/user?username=<User_Name>
fields.summary: Certain REST API endpoints require UserKey instead of UserName

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, Jira includes joda 2.8.x, which does not include the updates for daylight saving time on Brazil (starting Nov 4 this year).

This causes Jira to display date fields incorrectly, since the daylight saving rule is outdated.

h3. Environment
* Any Jira environment using the America/São Paulo timezone

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start Jira in any version
# Make sure to use the America/São Paulo timezone
# Create an issue

h3. Expected Results

Jira will display the created date correctly, following the rules for the America/São Paulo timezone.

h3. Actual Results


Jira will display the date with 1 hour difference, since it is applying the daylight saving incorrectly

h3.Workaround


# Replacing the [joda jar file|https://search.maven.org/remotecontent?filepath=joda-time/joda-time/2.10.1/joda-time-2.10.1.jar] at *$JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib*, which could have some problems in other places as we haven't tested it thoroughly
# Replacing the tz files as suggested in https://www.joda.org/joda-time/tz_update.html

It's also necessary to update Java's tz with tzupdater since Jira uses both Joda and Java's times:

* https://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/tzupdater-download-513681.html
fields.summary: Include joda 2.10.5 in Jira

Comment on the issue and you will receive the communications breakdown issue as the issue key its using in the URL was dropped. \\  \\ \\ Workaround:\\ 1.	Make sure there is no trailing slash on the issue link: http://jiraserver.com/browse/ISSUE-123
fields.summary: Trailing Forward Slash on an Issue Key causes URL to truncate

You will find 2 Screens which are named "PROC0356: …." Which are mapped into workflows "TESTPRCMGM: …."

 - "PROC0356: Simple Issue Tracking Resolve Issue Screen" ( mapped to TESTPRCMGM workflow)
 - TESTORCMGM:Process Management Edit/View Issue Screen (mapped to TESTPRCMGM Process Management Screen Scheme)
 - TESTORCMGM:Process Management Create Issue Screen (mapped to TESTPRCMGM Process Management Screen Scheme)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Create Issue takes longer when there are configured WebHooks with Create Issue event.

The WebHooks are fired asynchronously, but the _logic that evaluates whether a WebHook should be called is *synchronous* and executes one JQL query per each configured WebHook_.

On instances that have problems with slow JQLs or with overly complicated WebHook filters configured, this can increase the time it takes to perform actions in Jira.
h3. Environment

An environment where there are WebHooks with Create Issue event and with complex JQL queries.
h3. Expected Results

When a customer creates an issue, they should swiftly see it's created on the UI. Slow JQLs configured for the WebHooks shouldn't impact the issue creation time.
h3. Actual Results

The customer clicks on Create Issue, Issue is created and the logic determining which WebHooks to call is executed. After all JQL filters are executed, user sees the new issue in the UI and the actual WebHooks are called in separate background threads.

h3. Workaround

No workaround if Webhooks will be used. But if the aim is to increase the performance of creating issue, then Webhooks should be disabled or JQLs should be tuned.
h3. Fix

Asynchronous Webhooks were introduced in version 8.19.1. They should significantly improve the performance of Webhooks with complex JQL queries. To enable them:
 # manually enable the "_com.atlassian.jira.webhookEventsAsyncProcessing_" feature flag [with following instruction|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/enable-dark-feature-in-jira-959286331.html].
 # restart your Jira instance (or each node in case of DC)

when using the "copy board" option of an existing board , 

 a new filter for this board is not created and so both boards are using the same filter

 

please add an option to a also create a new filter

this is useful in cases in which I want to copy the same board configs to a new project.

for example - copy the queries in the colors , or copy the swimlane queries .

 

it is useful incases in which 2 boards already exist and we want to make one to be configured the same as the other .

fields.description:
As a Project Administrator, I would like to view the audit log for my project without being a JIRA Administrator.

This would allow project administrators to see the history of versions, roles, and components without being a JIRA Administrator. The view should be limited to the "projects" category and the individual project.
fields.summary: Let Project Admins view the Audit Logs for their Project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Editing an existing Issue Collector will silently fail when the selected issue type's field configuration has had a non-anonymous custom field (such as Due Date) set to required. The page will act as though the configuration is saved upon clicking the *Update* button, but if you click back into the collector you'll note that your changes were not saved.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a project, configure a new issue collector. Specifics don't matter.
# Configure a new Field Configuration Scheme for the project, for one of the issue types set a [non-anonymous custom field type|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver076/using-the-issue-collector-945111295.html#Usingtheissuecollector-Addinganissuecollector] (such as Due Date) to be required.
# Attempt to edit the issue collector (e.g., change the reporter)

h3. Expected Results
Jira should throw an error indicating that the issue collector cannot be modified due to required fields that can't be displayed to anonymous users, similar to the behavior reported in [JRASERVER-67094|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67094].

h3. Actual Results
Silent Failure in the UI, nor are there any errors thrown to standard logging.
 
h3.Workaround
Temporarily convert required fields to Optional prior to making your edits.
fields.summary: Silent failure when editing an issue collector if non-anonymous custom fields have been set to required

fields.description: Our company has an incredible amount of custom fields.  Loading our Custom Fields page within Jira Administration takes several minutes.  My request is to provide a filter on the page.  For example: view by field type.
fields.summary: Add filtered view for Custom Fields page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA inefficiently populates _fieldLayoutCache_ due to slow loading and large size of FieldLayoutItems. JIRA loads elements into _fieldLayoutCache_ by FIELDLAYOUT and at the same time load all related  rows from {{FieldLayoutItem}} table. 
See related ticket for context JRASERVER-66013.
 
Since _fieldLayoutCache_ is used in many places, slow population will cause performance problems, see for example: JRASERVER-29310 and JRASERVER-61166. 

h3. Environment
* Large number of rows in {{fieldlayoutitem}} table - 200k+: 
{code:SQL|borderStyle=solid}
 select count(1) from fieldlayoutitem; 
1355666
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Population of _fieldLayoutCache_ is fast

h3. Actual Results
Population of _fieldLayoutCache_ is slow. 

h3. Note
* SQL logs will have the following:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
SELECT ID, FIELDLAYOUT, FIELDIDENTIFIER, DESCRIPTION, VERTICALPOSITION, ISHIDDEN, ISREQUIRED, RENDERERTYPE FROM public.fieldlayoutitem WHERE FIELDLAYOUT='10100'"
{code}
* Stack-trace of the long running thread will be similar to this: 
{noformat}
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.AbstractFieldLayoutManager.getRelevantFieldLayout(AbstractFieldLayoutManager.java:264)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.DefaultFieldLayoutManager.getFieldLayout(DefaultFieldLayoutManager.java:702)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.DefaultFieldLayoutManager.getUniqueFieldLayouts(DefaultFieldLayoutManager.java:586)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.DefaultFieldLayoutManager.getUniqueFieldLayouts(DefaultFieldLayoutManager.java:562)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.DefaultFieldManager.findVisibleFieldLayouts(DefaultFieldManager.java:503)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.DefaultFieldManager.getUniqueSchemes(DefaultFieldManager.java:419)
...
{noformat}
* Other action might also flush _fieldLayoutCache_, some examples (not limited to that):
** Add issue type - /secure/admin/AddIssueType.jspa 
** Remove issue type - /secure/admin/DeleteIssueType.jspa
** Add issue type scheme -  /secure/admin/ConfigureOptionSchemes.jspa
** Remove issue type scheme -  /secure/admin/DeleteOptionScheme.jspa
fields.summary: Make FieldLayoutCache population more efficient in Jira

fields.description:
Hi Team,

We have a custom field called "AIERulename" its a Text Field. I want to add it to "Statistics Type" in pie chart. when I'm trying to add its not showing the Text Filed type Custom Fields in the Statistics Type dropdown list. Here each Tickets have a different "AIERuleNames" some times will use the similar name depends upon  ticket. Here If I add this field to the Pie chart gadget so that i can see the report how many ticket created per month with similar AIERuleName  

Can any one suggest me regards this.

Thanks,
fields.summary: I want to add"Text Field" type Custom field to "Statistics Type" in Workload Pie Chart how to add ??

fields.description:
Hi Team,

Here i'm creating a notification Scheme so in that one of my requirement is I have a field called "Group"  and I have groups in jira  "X,Y,Z " .

>When any user "Creates" a Ticket and In the "Group" Field when the user select a group "X"   and the group selected in that field have to get notification that the ticket is created . If they Select the "Y or Z" in that "Group" field is not required get Notification.

Notification have to send  only when  the group "X" selected in the field only for that group members have to notify

can any one please suggest how to achieve this.

 

Thanks
fields.summary: Depends UpOn Value Of  Custom Field the Notification has to send

        at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:68)
        ... 41 filtered
        at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.request.RedirectInterceptingFilter.doFilter(RedirectInterceptingFilter.java:21)
        ... 57 filtered
        at com.atlassian.jira.security.JiraSecurityFilter.lambda$doFilter$0(JiraSecurityFilter.java:66)
        ... 1 filtered
{code}

Instead of having a complex stack trace, it'd be a lot more helpful to get a message triggered on logs and UI saying that the option or value on the filter isn't countable or measurable in this scenario and hence unsupported by the gadget. Something like *You can only use sortable custom fields in this widget. Check your configuration* could be displayed so the message is a lot more informative than the exception itself.
fields.summary: Display a more informative error about wrong configuration when using non sortable values on Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget

fields.description:
h3. Summary

 When trying to link an issue or page in agile board, nothing happens when clicking on "search for an issue/page".

Precondition:
Jira is connected to a Confluence server.
*Steps to recreate*
1. Open any agile board in Active Sprint mode.
2. Select one issue
3. Choose on the right issue quick view from the "..." "Link"
4. in the new opened dialog select either "Jira Issue" or "confluence page"
5. Press "search for issue/page"

Expectation: 
The dialog for searching for Confluence Pages / Jira Issues should appear.

h3. Note: 

Reproduced with IE, Firefox and Chrome with Jira Server Versions: 7.9.0 and 7.11.2. 
In classic full screen issue view, Link works as expected.
fields.summary: Link "search for issue/page" in agile board quick view not working

{code:none} 
||Heading 1||Heading 2||Heading 1||Heading 2||Heading 1||Heading 2||Heading 1||Heading 2||
|Col A1|Col A2|Col A1|Col A2|Col A1|Col A2|Col A1|Col A2|
|Col A1|Col A2|Col A1|Col A2|Col A1|Col A2|Col A1|Col A2|
|Col A1|Col A2|Col A1|Col A2|Col A1|Col A2|Col A1|Col A2|
|Col A1|Col A2|Col A1|Col A2|Col A1|Col A2|Col A1|Col A2|
|Col A1|Col A2|Col A1|Col A2|Col A1|Col A2|Col A1|Col A2|
{code} 
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-25 at 2.47.44 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Save it.

# Switch to VIsual mode.

 !Screen Shot 2018-10-25 at 2.48.00 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Save it again. 

h3. *Expected Results*

 !Screen Shot 2018-10-25 at 3.06.46 PM.png|thumbnail!

 !Screen Shot 2018-10-25 at 2.48.09 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Notes*

 !Screen Shot 2018-10-25 at 2.49.00 PM.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
As per ticket JRASERVER-9258, Jira is not able to escape backslashes without using workarounds.

We suggest implementing functionality (changing how escaping works), so that backslash could be escaped without using mentioned workarounds, that is, by adding additional backslash.
fields.summary: Change Wiki Markup backslash escape behaviour

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
JIRA webhooks currently have no way of guaranteeing delivery, thus, integrity between changes made in JIRA and updates to a remote system are very hard to reconcile in the case of momentary failure or outage at the remote endpoint. See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29856

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide a convenient log in JIRA webhook administration that records basic information about webhook POSTs and their status (failure/success), not necessarily detailed contents. So that admins can filter out failed messages easily.
 * Ensure there is a job that automatically cleans or trims this record - say every 30 days or so to avoid blowing up the database from it.
* It may also be a neat feature to allow this webhook logs to be queried by an API, so that users are able to automate fetching of missed issue updates for changes whose webhooks POSTs had failed to deliver, after the remote system has recovered
fields.summary: As an admin I would like to be able to track JIRA webhooks delivery success or failure from the UI

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Jira 7.12 new functionality was added to assign filter viewers and editors. For an editor to be able to save changes to a filter, however, they *must* be a member of all groups that the filter is shared with. If this condition isn't met, when attempting to save the filter the user will be presented with the following error:
 !filter_error.png|thumbnail! 

The error isn't very helpful and does not provide the user with an understanding of why they're unable to save their filter changes.

h3. Suggested Solution
Capture this scenario and provide a more contextual error message describing why the filter can't be saved.

h3. Why this is important
The current error is very ambiguous and is therefore a call-driver to support. Providing a more contextual error will allow users and their administrators to understand the failure case.
fields.summary: As a user who is assigned an editor role for a filter, I'd like more contextual error messages when I can't save edits to the filter

Steps:

Adding the next-gen templates to the classic templates view will allow me to select the correct template and thus create the correct project type.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Background reindex is not supposed to fix the broken index. It shouldn't be possible to trigger it when the index is broken.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Run Jira 7.12.3 with existing issues
# Stop Jira
# remove index files
{code}
rm -rf <jirahome>/caches/indexes/
{code}
# Start Jira
# Go to "Jira indexing" administration page ({{<Jira_URL>/secure/admin/jira/IndexAdmin.jspa}})

h4. Expected result
Jira won't allow you to perform background reindex
In Jira 7.6.9 the screen looked like this:
 !indexing-jira-7.6.9.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Actual result
Jira will allow you to perform background reindex
 !indexing-jira-7.12.3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround known
fields.summary: Background reindex can be triggered with broken Jira index
